item.name: Receives notification for new shipment for move

description.content:
This request can be used to show that the Prime cannot access a Move until
    it is made available to the Prime.

    This request must be run before the Move is available to the Prime
    otherwise there will never be a 404 response for the template to show the
    error message.

    This request can also be used to show that the Prime has access to a Move
    given a Move Code or a MoveID and will show a success notification.

    This Request uses the templates found in
    **templates/prime-notification/receive-move.html**.

exec: // By default, a shipment would not have a Reweigh until it was requested.
// If the Move is found, we'll update the view object. Otherwise, we'll
// consider the response to be a 404 and modify the view for and error state.
view.alertTitle = 'Move is now available to GHC Prime Contractor';
view.alertTitle = 'Move is not available to GHC Prime Contractor';

item.name: Update shipment with scheduled pickup date

description.content:
This request updates the Move with a scheduled pickup date This uses the
    template called **prime-update/counsels-move.html**.

exec: // Create a view object rather than using the Response object that comes from
// Postman so we can modify the presentation of things in JavaScript rather
// than Handlerbars. It's probably cleaner to do this in the Handlebar template
// TODO: Research moving a lot of this logic surrounding the View object in
// If the response is OK, let's modify the View object.
// These are coming from the previous requests.
// I don't like this, but we've got a bug that prevents the Prime from seeing
// Reweigh information when updating a shipment's details. The Swagger files
// says it returns the Reweigh object, but the actual response is missing it.
// TODO: Make a Jira ticket about this.
// FIXME: This is a terribly hacky way to do this, but the secondary
// request gets all the Shipments items and then we take the first one
// (as we're only expecting 1) and then we take that Reweigh object and
// put it in here so it's like the Prime API returns the Reweigh object
// TODO: This this to the Jira ticket, maybe.
view.reweighStatus      = 'ðŸŸ¢ A Reweigh has been requested.';
view.reweighStatus  = 'âœ… A Reweigh has been set by the GHC Contractor.';
// Attempt to set a bunch of variables or 'undefined'.
// These are being set for the next request to consume as a {{variable}}.

description.content:

This requests creates a Payment Request for a Move. This uses the
    template called **prime-update/submits-payment-request.html**.

  • Move code: {{moveCode}}
  • Move ID: {{moveID}}

    • {{/if}} {{#unless reweighSuccess}}

description.content:
This is a collection that represents the Prime's flow for the October Milmob 4
Demo. The following Prime Requests are performed in this collection.

- Request: Update shipment with a Reweigh
  - Postman Request 1: Prime gets notified a move has been created
  - Postman Request 2: Prime updates shipment with additional move details
  - Postman Request 3: Prime performs a reweigh
- Request: Prime gets notified that TOO approved move
  - Postman Request 4: Prime creates payment request to get paid
- Request: Prime submits a Proof of Service for Payment
  - Postman Request 5: Prime uploads proof of service documents
